meanings.definition: The process of soaking meat in a solution of salt and water to enhance flavor and tenderness.
meanings.sent1: Brining is a common technique used to make meat more flavorful.
meanings.sent2: I always use brining to make my chicken juicier and tastier.
meanings.sent3: After brining the turkey, it smelled so good that even the neighbors wanted to join us for dinner!
meanings.sent4: The chef's secret to delicious pork chops was brining them in a special marinade.
meanings.sent5: The brining process turned the bland chicken into a mouthwatering delight.

meanings.definition: The act of preserving food by soaking it in a salt solution.
meanings.sent1: Brining is an old method of keeping food fresh for a longer time.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother taught me the art of brining vegetables to store them for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The pickle jar fell, and suddenly the kitchen was filled with the strong smell of brining cucumbers.
meanings.sent4: In the past, sailors relied on brining to prevent their food from spoiling during long voyages.
meanings.sent5: The brining of fish was essential for communities living far from the sea.

meanings.definition: The practice of immersing food in a seasoned liquid before cooking.
meanings.sent1: Brining with herbs and spices can add a unique taste to your dishes.
meanings.sent2: Before grilling, I always spend time brining the meat to make it more flavorful.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled the brining mixture, creating a fragrant mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The art of brining has been passed down through generations in our family.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the brining liquid filled the room, making everyone hungry.
